item.title: 外汇 美元无精打采，市场准备迎接感恩节后的热闹气氛
item.description:
The U.S. dollar began the last week of November on the back foot and was on track for its biggest monthly drop in a year as traders eyed fresh economic cues in the week ahead to determine the future path of policy rates.翻译:11 月最后一周，美元开始表现不佳，并有望创下一年来最大月度跌幅，因为交易员关注未来一周的新经济线索，以确定政策利率的未来走势。

A postponed OPEC+ meeting, the release of the Federal Reserve's tracked measure of inflation alongside consumer prices data in the euro zone and Australia fill this week's calendar, which will also see a rate decision from the Reserve Bank of New Zealand and Chinese PMI data.翻译:推迟的欧佩克+会议、美联储发布的跟踪通胀指标以及欧元区和澳大利亚的消费者价格数据填满了本周的日程，新西兰联储和中国采购经理人指数数据也将在本周公布利率决定。

The dollar index , which measures the currency against six major peers, slipped as much as 0.2% to 103.22 and was headed for a monthly loss of more than 3%, its worst performance in a year.翻译:衡量美元兑六种主要货币的美元指数下跌 0.2%，至 103.22，月度跌幅将超过 3%，创一年来最差表现。

"Expectations are that U.S. rates have peaked which suggests it's time to get out of the dollar," said Colin Asher, senior economist at Mizuho Bank.翻译:瑞穗银行(Mizuho Bank)高级经济学家科林·阿舍尔(Colin Asher)表示，“预期美国利率已见顶，这表明是时候退出美元了”。

"U.S. equities have now completed four weeks in a row of gains and that's also weighing on safe-haven demand for the dollar," Asher said.翻译:阿舍表示：“美国股市现已完成连续四周上涨，这也打压了美元的避险需求。”

Traders, returning from the Thanksgiving lull late last week, continued to eye a peak in U.S. rates and turned their attention to when the first rate cuts could come, with this week's release of U.S. core PCE prices likely to offer more clues on the Fed's next steps.翻译:交易员从上周晚些时候的感恩节平静中恢复过来，继续关注美国利率见顶，并将注意力转向何时可能首次降息，本周公布的美国核心个人消费支出价格可能会为美联储下一步降息提供更多线索。脚步。

"Insofar as CPI inflation rates across much of the G10 are still above central bank targets, there is a strong incentive for policymakers to support the 'higher for longer' theme since higher market rates will help in the battle against inflation," said Jane Foley, senior FX strategist at Rabobank.翻译:Jane Foley 表示：“只要 G10 国家大部分地区的消费者物价指数 (CPI) 通胀率仍高于央行目标，政策制定者就会有强烈的动力支持‘长期走高’的主题，因为较高的市场利率将有助于对抗通胀。” ，荷兰合作银行高级外汇策略师。

"Investors, however, are looking through this policy and appear increasingly pre-occupied about betting on the timing and pace of rate cuts next year."翻译:“然而，投资者正在审视这项政策，并似乎越来越全神贯注于押注明年降息的时机和步伐。”

Market pricing shows a roughly 23% chance that the Fed may begin easing monetary policy as early as March, according to the CME FedWatch tool.翻译:根据 CME FedWatch 工具，市场定价显示美联储最早可能在 3 月份开始放松货币政策的可能性约为 23%。

Elsewhere, the British pound rose against the weaker dollar to a more than two-month high of $1.2627, extending its gains from last week following data showing that British companies unexpectedly reported a marginal return to growth in November after three months of contraction.翻译:其他方面，英镑兑疲软的美元上涨至两个多月高点1.2627美元，延续上周的涨势，此前数据显示英国企业在经历三个月的收缩后意外地报告11月份小幅恢复增长。

"The most recent PMI data were good in the UK, implying that things are not as quite bleak as they seemed," Mizuho's Asher said.翻译:瑞穗银行的阿舍尔表示：“英国最新的采购经理人指数数据良好，这意味着情况并不像看起来那么黯淡。”

The pound was on track for a roughly 3.8% gain for the month, its largest monthly gain since a more than 5% rise in November last year.翻译:英镑本月有望上涨约 3.8%，这是自去年 11 月涨幅超过 5% 以来的最大月度涨幅。

The dollar fell 0.2% to 149.08 yen , while the euro gained 0.1% to $1.0941.翻译:美元兑日元下跌0.2%，至149.08日元；欧元兑美元上涨0.1%，至1.0941美元。

The Australian dollar climbed to a more than three-month high of $0.66, while the kiwi edged 0.1% higher to $0.6091 before the RBNZ interest rate decision on Wednesday, where the central bank is seen keeping rates unchanged at 5.5%, as they have been since the last adjustment in May.翻译:澳元兑美元攀升至逾三个月高点 0.66 美元，新西​​兰元则小幅上涨 0.1%，至 0.6091 美元，之后新西兰联储周三将利率决定，预计央行将维持利率在 5.5% 不变，一如此前的决定。自5月份上次调整以来。

In China, the yuan slipped after the official midpoint snapped five straight sessions of strengthening, with the onshore yuan last at 7.1518 per dollar.翻译:在中国，人民币在官方中间价结束连续五个交易日走强后下滑，在岸人民币兑美元汇率最新报7.1518。

Its offshore counterpart fell 0.1% to 7.1579 per dollar.翻译:离岸货币兑美元汇率下跌 0.1%，至 7.1579 美元。

Prior to market opening, the People's Bank of China set the midpoint rate , around which the yuan is allowed to trade in a 2% band, at 7.1159 per dollar, 8 pips weaker than the previous fix of 7.1151.翻译:开市前，中国人民银行将人民币兑美元汇率中间价设定为7.1159，比之前的中间价7.1151低8个点，允许人民币在2%的区间内交易。

Reporting by Samuel Indyk and Rae Wee; Editing by Gerry Doyle, Christopher Cushing and Toby Chopra翻译:Samuel Indyk 和 Rae Wee 的报道；编辑：格里·多伊尔、克里斯托弗·库欣和托比·乔普拉

item.title: 货币冲突导致俄罗斯与亚洲的石油贸易恶化
item.description:
Summary:
  • This content was partly produced in Russia where the law restricts coverage of Russian military operations in Ukraine
  • Russian banking source says "pointless" to receive rupees
  • Russia has more use for China's yuan
  • Analysts say more Indian exports to Russia could help
  • Increased oil price cap scrutiny aggravates the problem
翻译:概括：
  • 此内容部分在俄罗斯制作，该国法律限制报道俄罗斯在乌克兰的军事行动
  • 俄罗斯银行业消息人士称接收卢比“毫无意义”
  • 俄罗斯更愿意使用人民币
  • 分析师表示，印度对俄罗斯的更多出口可能会有所帮助
  • 加强石油价格上限审查加剧了问题

One of Russia's most lucrative oil trade routes since the imposition of Western sanctions over the Ukraine conflict faces a major challenge because of the drawbacks of payment in currency other than dollars, with no short-term solution in sight.翻译:自西方对乌克兰冲突实施制裁以来，俄罗斯最有利可图的石油贸易路线之一面临着重大挑战，因为以美元以外的货币支付存在缺陷，短期内看不到解决方案。

For decades, the U.S. dollar has been the currency of international oil trade and efforts to find alternatives have been thwarted by the difficulties of conversion, as well as political obstacles.翻译:几十年来，美元一直是国际石油贸易的货币，寻找替代货币的努力因兑换困难和政治障碍而受阻。

The problems flared when India - which has become Russia's biggest buyer of seaborne oil since European customers retreated - insisted in July on paying in rupees and the trading activity nearly fell apart, according to three sources familiar with the matter.翻译:据三位知情人士透露，自欧洲客户撤退以来，印度已成为俄罗斯最大的海运石油买家，但当印度在 7 月份坚持以卢比付款时，问题就爆发了，贸易活动几乎崩溃。

The sources, who requested anonymity, said the Russian oil suppliers - who also could not be named because of the issue's sensitivity - could not do deals in Indian rupees because of informal guidance from the Russian central bank it would not accept the currency.翻译:要求匿名的消息人士称，俄罗斯石油供应商 - 由于问题的敏感性而无法透露姓名 - 无法以印度卢比进行交易，因为俄罗斯央行的非正式指导是不接受印度卢比。

One Russian banking source close to the Russian central bank said receiving revenue in a non-convertible currency with little value outside India was "pointless". Russia has limited opportunities to spend rupees as its imports from India are insignificant, another source said.翻译:一位与俄罗斯央行关系密切的俄罗斯银行业消息人士表示，以在印度境外价值不大的不可兑换货币获得收入“毫无意义”。另一位消息人士称，俄罗斯消费卢比的机会有限，因为其从印度的进口量微不足道。

The Russia central bank did not respond to requests for comment.翻译:俄罗斯央行没有回应置评请求。

Around mid-August, at least two major Russian oil companies threatened to divert around a dozen tankers carrying up to a million tonnes of oil that were heading to India to other destinations, according to two of the sources.翻译:据两名消息人士透露，8 月中旬左右，至少两家俄罗斯大型石油公司威胁要将大约 12 艘运往印度的油轮转移至其他目的地，这些油轮载有多达 100 万吨石油。

As a temporary solution to the clash involving Indian deals, the cargoes were paid for in a combination of the Chinese yuan, the Hong-Kong dollar as a transition currency into the yuan and the UAE dirham, which is pegged to the U.S. dollar, 10 trading sources and officials told Reuters.翻译:作为涉及印度交易的冲突的临时解决方案，货物以人民币、作为人民币过渡货币的港元和与美元挂钩的阿联酋迪拉姆的组合支付，10贸易消息人士和官员告诉路透社。

They said, however, the problem remained of finding a viable alternative to the dollar, and that the problems affect buyers in Africa, China and Turkey which have become top buyers of Russian oil.翻译:然而，他们表示，问题仍然是找到美元的可行替代品，这些问题影响到非洲、中国和土耳其的买家，这些买家已成为俄罗斯石油的最大买家。

The biggest issue, however, concerns India, which has been buying more than 60% of Russian seaborne oil, according to LSEG data and Reuters calculations. It is the biggest overall buyer of seaborne Russian crude after China.翻译:然而，最大的问题在于印度，根据伦敦证券交易所集团的数据和路透社的计算，印度购买了超过 60% 的俄罗斯海运石油。它是继中国之后俄罗斯海运原油的最大总体买家。

The problems are likely to worsen as scrutiny on the trade increases. Washington imposed the first sanctions on owners of tankers carrying Russian oil priced above a Western price cap in recent weeks, the first enforcement of the cap since it was introduced late last year.

DITCHING THE DOLLAR

Since Western sanctions imposed on Russia in February last year, Moscow has shifted from transactions in dollars and euros, the world's dominant currencies, and is largely locked out of the international banking system.翻译:自去年2月西方对俄罗斯实施制裁以来，莫斯科已不再以美元和欧元这两种世界主要货币进行交易，并且基本上被排除在国际银行体系之外。

According to five traders involved, less than 10% of Russia's output of roughly 9 million barrels of oil per day (bpd) is sold in dollars and euros.翻译:据五名参与交易的交易商称，俄罗斯每天约 900 万桶石油产量中，只有不到 10% 以美元和欧元出售。

The Russian central bank cannot operate in dollars because of sanctions, and while Russian exporters theoretically can use the currency, avoiding it has the advantage of making it harder for the United States and other Western governments to monitor their trade.翻译:由于制裁，俄罗斯央行无法以美元运作，虽然理论上俄罗斯出口商可以使用美元，但避免使用美元的好处是让美国和其他西方政府更难监控其贸易。

The alternatives, however, lead to high levels of risk for both parties to a deal.翻译:然而，其他选择会给交易双方带来很高的风险。

India in the first months of this year owed about $40 billion to Russia for oil and other supplies, according to four trading and banking sources, who said the amount was now significantly lower without giving a precise details.翻译:据四位贸易和银行消息人士透露，今年头几个月，印度欠俄罗斯约 400 亿美元的石油和其他供应品，但他们表示，这一数额现在明显下降，但没有透露具体细节。

The Russian central bank also declined to give details.

RUPEE A PARTICULAR ISSUE

Doing business in rupees is particularly difficult for Russia.翻译:对于俄罗斯来说，用卢比做生意尤其困难。

India encourages rupees to be spent on its territory and has imposed punitive exchange rates on converting rupees into other currencies, amounting on occasions to over 10% of the amount converted, according to two Russian sources.翻译:据两名俄罗斯消息人士称，印度鼓励卢比在其领土上消费，并对卢比兑换成其他货币实施惩罚性汇率，有时金额超过兑换金额的 10%。

The situation could ease if Russia imported more goods from India, which could be paid for in rupees.翻译:如果俄罗斯从印度进口更多商品（可以用卢比支付），情况可能会有所缓解。

Instead, India has been importing more from Russia, while Russia has been a major importer of cars, equipment and other goods from China.翻译:相反，印度一直从俄罗斯进口更多商品，而俄罗斯一直是中国汽车、设备和其他商品的主要进口国。

India's imports from Russia reached $30.4 billion in April-September, with its trade deficit with Moscow widening to $28.4 billion compared with about $17 billion in the same period last year, according to the data posted on the Indian commerce ministry website.翻译:印度商务部网站公布的数据显示，4月至9月印度从俄罗斯的进口额达到304亿美元，与莫斯科的贸易逆差扩大至284亿美元，而去年同期约为170亿美元。

Ivan Nosov, head of the Indian branch of Russia's top state bank Sberbank, said Russian exporters will have to help India to increase its exports.翻译:俄罗斯最高国有银行储蓄银行印度分行行长伊万·诺索夫表示，俄罗斯出口商将不得不帮助印度增加出口。

"If you help increase Indian exports, there will immediately be a lot of help from various Indian associations. You create a company in India, do a small localisation and you will get more opportunities," he said.翻译:“如果你帮助增加印度出口，印度各个协会会立即提供大量帮助。你在印度创建一家公司，进行小型本地化，你将获得更多机会，”他说。

India's top refiner Indian Oil Corp (IOC.NS) is struggling to settle some payments, mainly for the purchase of Russia's light, sweet Sokol grade from the Sakhalin 1 project.翻译:印度最大的炼油商印度石油公司(IOC.NS)正在努力解决一些付款问题，主要用于从萨哈林 1 号项目购买俄罗斯轻质低硫 Sokol 级原油。

The IOC has said it has been unable to pay for the Sokol deliveries because the company supplying the grade has yet to open an account in UAE dirhams to receive payment, a source said.翻译:消息人士称，国际奥委会表示，它无法支付索科尔的交付费用，因为供应该等级的公司尚未开设阿联酋迪拉姆账户来接收付款。

The IOC did not respond to Reuters' requests for comment.

YUAN PREFERRED

Russian officials and oil executives have pressed Indian buyers to pay in Chinese yuan, which for Russia is a more useful currency.翻译:俄罗斯官员和石油高管敦促印度买家以人民币付款，这对俄罗斯来说是一种更有用的货币。

For India, using the currency of a regional rival is highly sensitive, although Indian private refiners have switched back to the yuan due to the lack of other options since the clash earlier this year, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，对印度来说，使用地区竞争对手的货币是高度敏感的，尽管自今年早些时候的冲突以来，由于缺乏其他选择，印度私营炼油厂已转回使用人民币。

Indian state refiners have turned to the UAE dirham, but that has been complicated by additional clearing requirements as Washington's tougher line makes other governments wary.翻译:印度国营炼油商已转向阿联酋迪拉姆，但由于华盛顿的强硬路线让其他政府保持警惕，额外的清算要求使情况变得复杂。

From October, several UAE banks have tightened control over Russia-focused clients to ensure compliance with the price cap, according to five oil trading and bank sources.翻译:据五位石油交易和银行消息人士透露，从 10 月份开始，几家阿联酋银行加强了对以俄罗斯为重点的客户的控制，以确保遵守价格上限。

At least two UAE banks have introduced price cap compliance declarations for the clients involved in Russian crude, oil products and commodity trading, the sources said. They declined to name the banks.翻译:消息人士称，至少两家阿联酋银行已为参与俄罗斯原油、石油产品和大宗商品交易的客户引入了价格上限合规声明。他们拒绝透露银行名称。

Editing by Barbara Lewis翻译:芭芭拉·刘易斯编辑

item.title: 世界卫生组织官员：中国呼吸系统疾病的激增程度没有大流行前那么高
item.description:
The spike in respiratory illnesses that China is currently going through is not as high as before the COVID-19 pandemic, a World Health Organisation official said, reiterating that no new or unusual pathogens had been found in the recent cases.翻译:世界卫生组织官员表示，中国目前呼吸道疾病的激增程度没有 COVID-19 大流行之前那么高，并重申在最近的病例中没有发现新的或不寻常的病原体。

Maria Van Kerkhove, acting director of the WHO's department of epidemic and pandemic preparedness and prevention, said the increase appeared to be driven by a rise in the number of children contracting pathogens that two years of COVID restrictions have kept them away from.翻译:世界卫生组织流行病和大流行防备与预防部门代理主任玛丽亚·范·科霍夫表示，感染人数增加似乎是由于感染病原体的儿童数量增加所致，而两年来的新冠病毒限制措施使他们远离了这些病原体。

"We asked about comparisons prior to the pandemic. And the waves that they’re seeing now, the peak is not as high as what they saw in 2018-2019," Van Kerkhove told health news outlet STAT in an interview on Friday.翻译:“我们询问了大流行之前的比较。他们现在看到的浪潮，峰值并不像他们在 2018-2019 年看到的那么高，”Van Kerkhove 在周五接受健康新闻媒体 STAT 采访时表示。

"This is not an indication of a novel pathogen. This is expected. This is what most countries dealt with a year or two ago," she added.翻译:“这并不是新病原体的迹象。这是预料之中的。这是大多数国家一两年前处理过的问题，”她补充道。

China's National Health Commission spokesperson Mi Feng said on Sunday the surge in acute respiratory illnesses was linked to the simultaneous circulation of several kinds of pathogens, most prominently influenza.翻译:国家卫生健康委员会新闻发言人米锋周日表示，急性呼吸道疾病的激增与多种病原体同时传播有关，其中最突出的是流感。翻译:中国国家卫生健康委员会发言人米锋周日表示，急性呼吸道疾病的激增与多种病原体的同时传播有关，其中最突出的是流感。

The spike become a global issue last week when the World Health Organization asked China for more information, citing a report on clusters of undiagnosed pneumonia in children by the Program for Monitoring Emerging Diseases.翻译:上周，世界卫生组织引用新发疾病监测计划关于儿童未确诊肺炎群的报告， 要求中国提供更多信息，从而使病例激增成为一个全球性问题。

China and the WHO have faced questions about the transparency of reporting early in the pandemic, which emerged in the central Chinese city of Wuhan in late 2019. The WHO said on Friday no new or unusual pathogens had been found in the recent illnesses.翻译:中国和世界卫生组织在 2019 年底在中国中部城市武汉爆发的疫情早期报告透明度方面面临质疑。世界卫生组织周五表示，在最近的疾病中没有发现新的或不寻常的病原体。

Reporting by Andrew Silver; Editing by Miyoung Kim and Miral Fahmy翻译:安德鲁·西尔弗报道；编辑：Miyoung Kim 和 Miral Fahmy

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，北京证券交易所要求“大股东”不要出售股票
item.description:
The Beijing Stock Exchange has de facto implemented a new policy that prevents major shareholders of companies listed on its bourse from selling stock, worried that such sales could douse a long-desired rally, three people familiar with the matter said.翻译:三名知情人士表示，北京证券交易所实际上实施了一项新政策，禁止在该交易所上市公司的大股东出售股票，担心此类出售可能会浇灭长期以来渴望的涨势。

The bourse, launched two years ago, was set up to help facilitate funding for innovative small companies, dubbed "little giants", but had languished due to lack of investor interest.翻译:该交易所成立于两年前，旨在帮助为被称为“小巨人”的创新型小公司提供融资，但由于缺乏投资者兴趣而陷入困境。

But the market's benchmark 50 Index (.CSI899050) has surged 46% this month on the back of recent measures by authorities. These include lowering the required amount of funds an investor must have in their stock account to invest, improving trading mechanisms and encouraging mutual funds to participate in the market.翻译:但在当局近期采取的措施的推动下，市场基准 50 指数(.CSI899050)本月已飙升 46%。这些措施包括降低投资者股票账户投资所需的资金数额、改进交易机制以及鼓励共同基金参与市场。

A "major shareholder" is one with a stake of 5% or more and is required to make a public filing with the relevant stock exchange before selling shares, according to rules for China's bourses.翻译:根据中国证券交易所的规定，“大股东”是指持股5%或以上的股东，在出售股份之前必须向相关证券交易所进行公开备案。

The Beijing exchange has been rejecting those filings, said the people who were not authorised to speak to media and declined to be identified.翻译:未获授权接受媒体采访并拒绝透露姓名的人士表示，北京交易所一直拒绝这些文件。

It was not immediately clear how long this new policy would remain in place, they added.翻译:他们补充说，目前尚不清楚这项新政策将持续多久。

The Beijing exchange and the China Securities Regulatory Commission did not immediately reply to requests for comment.翻译:北京交易所和中国证监会没有立即回复置评请求。

The bourse said separately in a statement on Monday morning ahead of this Reuters article that it was closely monitoring trading to ensure normal market order.翻译:在路透社发表这篇文章之前，该交易所在周一上午的一份声明中单独表示，它正在密切监控交易，以确保正常的市场秩序。

The so-called window guidance - where directives are made orally without written documents - is aimed at protecting the rally, the sources said.翻译:消息人士称，所谓的窗口指导——即在没有书面文件的情况下以口头方式作出指示——旨在保护集会。

One noted that without the guidance, the share price surge "could prompt institutional shareholders to reduce their holdings which could knock the index down again."翻译:一位人士指出，如果没有指引，股价飙升“可能会促使机构股东减持，从而导致该指数再次下跌。”

The Beijing bourse currently houses 232 companies with a combined market capitalisation of 366 billion yuan ($50 billion).翻译:北京证券交易所目前拥有 232 家公司，总市值达 3,660 亿元人民币（500 亿美元）。

By comparison, the Shanghai bourse is home to 2,256 firms worth 47 trillion yuan in total, while almost 3,000 companies listed in Shenzhen have a total market capitalisation of 31.9 trillion yuan. The Shanghai Composite Index (.SSEC) is up 0.4% this month, while the Shenzhen Composite Index (.SZI) is down 0.8%.翻译:相比之下，上海证券交易所拥有2,256家公司，总市值达47万亿元人民币，而深圳证券交易所有近3,000家上市公司，总市值达31.9万亿元人民币。上海综合指数(.SSEC)本月上涨 0.4%，而深圳综合指数(.SZI)则下跌 0.8%。

($1 = 7.2111 Chinese yuan)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2111 人民币）

item.title: 早间买盘：丰收月份后市场转向规避风险
item.description:
A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.翻译:韦恩·科尔 (Wayne Cole) 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。

Asia started Monday in hesitant fashion and has turned steadily grimmer, although there is no obvious catalyst for the risk-off mood. Most regional share markets are modestly lower, as are Wall Street and European futures.翻译:亚洲市场周一开局犹豫不决，随后逐渐变得黯淡，尽管没有明显的催化剂来推动避险情绪。大多数地区股票市场均小幅走低，华尔街和欧洲期货也是如此。

Treasury yields are a few basis points higher, but that hasn't helped the dollar which lost ground to a broadly firmer yen. Oil prices have slipped further, while gold hit a six-month high above $2,017 an ounce - although no fundamental factors were evident behind the move.翻译:美国国债收益率上涨了几个基点，但这并没有帮助美元走强，美元因日元普遍走强而下跌。油价进一步下滑，而金价则触及每盎司 2,017 美元以上的六个月高位，尽管这一走势背后没有明显的基本面因素。

China's central bank announced it would encourage financial institutions to support private companies, including with a greater tolerance for non-performing loans. The market didn't seem impressed and China's blue chips (.CSI300) are down around 1.2%.翻译:中国央行宣布将鼓励金融机构支持私营企业，包括加大对不良贷款的容忍度。市场似乎并没有留下深刻的印象，中国蓝筹股(.CSI300)下跌约1.2%。

There has been a build-up of reports about official steps to support the property sector, including white-listing companies for loans, yet it's still mostly talk rather than action.翻译:关于支持房地产行业的官方措施（包括将贷款公司列入白名单）的报道不断增多，但仍主要是说说而已，而不是采取行动。

The official China PMI for November is due on Thursday and analysts generally look for a small pick-up and maybe a reading above 50.0.翻译:中国官方 11 月份 PMI 将于周四公布，分析师普遍预计该数据将小幅回升，甚至可能高于 50.0。

The approach of the month's end could also generate some caution given the hefty gains investors are sitting on. Japan's Nikkei (.N225) is up more than 8% so far in November, as is the S&P 500 - and that would be its best performance since mid-2022.翻译:考虑到投资者坐拥的巨额收益，月底的临近也可能引发一些谨慎情绪。 11 月份迄今为止，日本日经指数(.N225)上涨超过 8%，标准普尔 500 指数也是如此，这将是自 2022 年中期以来的最佳表现。

About 55% of the S&P 500's component shares are trading above their 200-day moving averages, the highest share in nearly two months, according to LPL Financial.翻译:LPL Financial 的数据显示，标普 500 指数成分股中约 55% 的交易价格高于 200 日移动均线，这是近两个月来的最高比例。

The oil market faces a tense few days ahead of a meeting of OPEC+ on Nov. 30, which was postponed from Sunday as producers struggled to forge a unanimous position.翻译:石油市场在 11 月 30 日举行的 OPEC+ 会议之前几天面临紧张局势，由于产油国难以达成一致立场，该会议从周日推迟。

OPEC+ sources have said that African oil producers are seeking higher caps for 2024, while media reports suggest that Saudi Arabia may extend its additional 1 million bpd voluntary production cut which is due to expire at the end of December.翻译:OPEC+消息人士称， 非洲石油生产国正在寻求2024年更高的上限，而媒体报道称，沙特阿拉伯可能会延长其将于12月底到期的额外100万桶/日自愿减产。

Brent was down another 0.8% today, and 8.6% for the month so far, which if sustained would be a boon both for the battle against inflation and for consumer spending power.翻译:布伦特原油今天又下跌 0.8%，本月迄今已下跌 8.6%，如果这种情况持续下去，将有利于对抗通胀和消费者的消费能力。

The Federal Reserve's favoured measure of inflation - personal consumption expenditures - is due on Thursday and forecast to dip back to 3.1%, in part due to falling gas prices. The core is seen easing to 3.5%, its lowest since mid-2021.翻译:美联储青睐的通胀指标——个人消费支出——将于周四到期，预计将回落至 3.1%，部分原因是汽油价格下跌。核心利率预计将降至 3.5%，为 2021 年中期以来的最低水平。

Data on EU inflation is also due Thursday, along with measures for Germany and Spain. Core EU inflation is forecast at 3.9%, the lowest since the middle of last year.翻译:欧盟通胀数据以及德国和西班牙的通胀数据也将于周四公布。欧盟核心通胀率预计为 3.9%，为去年年中以来的最低水平。

If realised, this will support market wagers of no more rate hikes, and policy easing in 2024. Futures imply around 80 basis points of cuts for both the Fed and the ECB, starting in June.翻译:如果实现，这将支持市场对 2024 年不再加息和放松政策的押注。期货意味着美联储和欧洲央行从 6 月份开始将降息约 80 个基点。

Fed Chair Jerome Powell will have a chance to push back against the doves at a Fireside Chat on Friday, and there are at least seven other Fed speakers on the docket this week.翻译:美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔将有机会在周五的炉边谈话中反击鸽派人士，本周至少还有其他七位美联储发言人。

European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde has also sounded in no hurry to ease and will have another opportunity to drive home the message at the EU parliament later on Monday.翻译:欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜·拉加德也表示并不急于放松货币政策，周一晚些时候将有机会在欧盟议会上再次传达这一信息。

Key developments that could influence markets on Monday:翻译:可能影响周一市场的主要事态发展：

- ECB President Christine Lagarde at ECON Hearing before the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament翻译:- 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜·拉加德在欧洲议会经济和货币事务委员会举行的 ECON 听证会上

- UK CBI distributive trades for Nov翻译:- 11 月份英国 CBI 分销交易

- U.S. new home sales, building permits for Oct翻译:- 10 月份美国新屋销售、建筑许可

By Wayne Cole; Editing by Edmund Klamann翻译:作者：韦恩·科尔；编辑：埃德蒙·克拉曼

item.title: 中国表示重视MH370事件的后续行动
item.description:
China values the follow-up to the incident of MH370, a Malaysia Airlines flight that went missing nearly 10 years ago, and hopes all sides maintain close communication and properly handle this issue, the foreign ministry said on Monday.翻译:外交部周一表示，中方重视近十年前马航MH370航班失踪事件的后续进展，希望各方保持密切沟通，妥善处理这一问题。

Spokesperson Wang Wenbin made the comments after a media report of a Chinese court holding the first hearing of a liability lawsuit filed by relatives of passengers on MH370.翻译:发言人汪文斌是在媒体报道中国法院就马航MH370乘客亲属提起的责任诉讼举行首次听证会后发表上述言论的。

item.title: 中国公务员考试报名人数创历史新高，希望就业有保障
item.description:
More than three million people took China's annual civil service exam on the weekend, state media reported on Monday, a record number that underscores young people's concerns about getting a secure job in a rocky economy.翻译:据官方媒体周一报道，上周末有超过三百万人参加了中国年度公务员考试，这一数字创历史新高，突显了年轻人对在动荡的经济中获得稳定工作的担忧。

With stubbornly high youth employment in the world's second-largest economy, the prospect of a less glamorous career in the civil service is increasingly attractive as private sector job opportunities dwindle.翻译:由于世界第二大经济体的青年就业率居高不下，随着私营部门就业机会的减少， 公务员部门不那么光鲜亮丽的职业前景变得越来越有吸引力。

"After all, the general environment is not good," one user of the Weibo social media platform said of economic prospects as posts about the civil service exam surged.翻译:随着有关公务员考试的帖子激增，微博社交媒体平台的一位用户在谈到经济前景时表示，“毕竟大环境不好。”

"Companies are laying off employees and closing down in large numbers. It is not stable at all, so I have to choose to be a civil servant. The less earnings is fine. At least I won't be unemployed and starve to death."翻译:“企业大量裁员、倒闭，一点也不稳定，所以我只能选择当公务员，收入少一点也好，至少不会失业、饿死。” ”

The exam was held simultaneously in 237 cities across the country on Sunday, the state-run China Daily reported.翻译:据官方媒体《中国日报》报道，考试周日在全国 237 个城市同时举行。

A record high of 39,600 vacancies are up for grabs at central government agencies and affiliated institutions. On average, 77 candidates are competing for every position, the Global Times newspaper reported.翻译:中央国家机关及直属机构空缺职位空缺数量创历史新高，达3.96万个。据《环球时报》报道，平均每个职位都有 77 名候选人竞争。

China is struggling to get its economy back on track after COVID-19 and the government has introduced a rash of policy measures, including strengthening financial support for private companies.翻译:新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 疫情过后，中国正努力让经济重回正轨，政府出台了一系列政策措施，包括加强对私营企业的金融支持。

The number of people trying to get into graduate school has also declined, the China News Network reported, with a researcher at the China National Academy of Educational Sciences citing insecurity about work as a factor.翻译:据中国新闻网报道，试图进入研究生院的人数也有所下降，中国国家教育科学研究院的一位研究员指出，工作不安全感是一个因素。

"For many undergraduate graduates, if they can find a job now, they will definitely prefer to work as soon as possible, said researcher Chu Zhaohui.翻译:“对于很多本科毕业生来说，如果现在能找到工作，他们肯定会更愿意尽快工作。”储朝晖研究员表示。

"Many people's expectations of finding a job after graduate school are relatively low."翻译:“许多人对研究生毕业后找到工作的期望相对较低。”

The Global Times reported that the number of civil service jobs had increased for the past five years. Last year, nearly 2.6 million candidates competed for 37,100 vacancies.翻译:据《环球时报》报道，过去五年来，公务员职位数量有所增加。去年，近260万名候选人竞争了37,100个职位空缺。

Reporting by Bernard Orr; Additional reporting by Beijing and Shanghai newsrooms; Editing by Robert Birsel翻译:伯纳德·奥尔报道；北京和上海新闻编辑室的补充报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔编辑

item.title: 北京对台湾反对派分裂感到担忧，各党派继续攻击与中国的关系
item.description:
Beijing is fretting that a split in Taiwan's opposition could pave the way for the island's ruling party - which the Chinese government despises - to stay in power, as China took centre stage in election campaigning over the weekend.翻译:北京担心，随着中国在周末的竞选活动中占据中心地位，台湾反对派的分裂可能会为中国政府所鄙视的台湾执政党继续掌权铺平道路。

China, which claims Taiwan as its own territory, looms large over the Jan. 13 presidential and parliamentary election as it has ramped up military pressure against the island.翻译:中国声称台湾是自己的领土，并加大了对台湾的军事压力，在 1 月 13 日的总统和议会选举中显得尤为突出。

Last week, negotiations for a united presidential ticket between the two main opposition parties, which seek closer ties with China, imploded, giving a boost to the ruling Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), already leading opinion polls.翻译:上周，寻求与中国建立更密切关系的两个主要反对党之间关于统一总统候选人的谈判破裂，这给已经在民意调查中领先的执政党民进党(DPP)带来了提振。

China's official response so far has been a brief statement from its Taiwan Affairs Office late Friday saying it hopes the election result will help maintain peace and stability, and reiterating that Taiwan faces "a choice between war and peace".翻译:迄今为止，中国官方的回应是国台办周五晚间发表的一份简短声明，称希望选举结果有助于维护和平与稳定，并重申台湾面临“战争与和平的选择”。

But on Chinese social media, the drama has been followed with a sense of despair at the opposition's disunity.翻译:但在中国社交媒体上，这部戏剧引发了对反对派不团结的绝望感。

Zhang Xuesong, director of strategic research at Chinese think tank CICG Asia-Pacific, wrote on his Weibo social media account that the disintegration of the talks was a "loss for cross-Taiwan Strait peace".翻译:中国智库CICG亚太战略研究部主任张雪松在其微博社交媒体账户上写道，会谈破裂是“台海和平的损失”。

"That was an extremely frustrating day," he added. "Of course, the only thing that gives us confidence is that Taiwan is one step closer to finally being reunified."翻译:“那是极其令人沮丧的一天，”他补充道。 “当然，唯一让我们有信心的是台湾距离最终统一又近了一步。”

Other Chinese Weibo accounts that follow Taiwan have been similarly despondent.翻译:其他关注台湾的中国微博账户也同样令人沮丧。

State-run Shenzhen Television wrote that the breakdown in talks signalled "a chaotic battle" to come in the election.翻译:国营深圳电视台写道，谈判破裂预示着选举将出现“一场混乱的战斗”。

One Chinese Weibo user wrote simply: "I saw news that the talks broke down, and now I've lost hope."翻译:一位中国微博用户简单地写道：“我看到谈判破裂的消息，现在我失去了希望。”

The DPP has defied Chinese pressure. Beijing views DPP presidential candidate Lai Ching-te as a separatist and has rebuffed repeated offers of talks from both him and Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen.翻译:民进党不顾中国的压力。北京将民进党总统候选人赖清德视为分裂分子，并拒绝了他和台湾总统蔡英文多次提出的会谈建议。

Speaking at a campaign rally on Sunday night in Taipei's sister city New Taipei, Lai said that if Taiwan accepts it is part of China - Beijing's bottom line for talks - it will lose sovereignty.翻译:周日晚上，黎智英在台北姐妹城市新北举行的竞选集会上发表讲话时表示，如果台湾承认自己是中国的一部分——北京谈判的底线——它将失去主权。

"With no sovereignty, you will have no ownership over your land, your homes," Lai said.翻译:“没有主权，你就没有对你的土地、你的家园的所有权，”赖说。

Hou Yu-ih, the candidate for Taiwan's largest opposition party, the Kuomintang (KMT), told his supporters that a vote for Lai was a vote for war and only he could bring peace. Lai and the DPP strongly dispute that point of view.翻译:台湾最大反对党国民党的候选人侯裕义告诉他的支持者，投票给黎智英就是投票给战争，只有他才能带来和平。赖和民进党强烈反对这一观点。

On Monday, China's Taiwan Affairs Office repeated its attacks on Lai and running mate Hsiao Bi-khim, formerly Taiwan's de facto ambassador to the United States.翻译:周一，中国台湾事务办公室再次攻击赖智和竞选搭档、台湾前驻美大使萧美琴。

Lai and Hsiao "distorted facts and downplayed the harmfulness and danger of 'Taiwan independence' separatist activities to deceive voters in the 2024 leadership election in Taiwan", it said.翻译:赖、萧“在台湾2024年领导人选举中歪曲事实、淡化‘台独’分裂活动的危害性和危险性，欺骗选民”。

Opinion polls since the opposition talks collapsed have given a mixed picture.翻译:自反对派谈判破裂以来的民意调查显示的情况好坏参半。

The Taiwanese Public Opinion Foundation said that just more than half of respondents to the question of who they regarded as having the "best prospects" of winning answered Lai.翻译:台湾民意基金会表示，在被问到“谁最有可能获胜”的问题上，只有一半以上的受访者回答了黎智英。

Television station ETtoday put Lai at about 35%, with Hou nipping at his heels with 33% and former Taipei mayor Ko Wen-je from the small Taiwan People's Party at 21%.翻译:ETtoday 电视台认为赖智民的支持率约为 35%，侯孝贤以 33% 紧随其后，台湾人民党的前台北市长柯文哲则为 21%。

A split opposition gives Lai an increased chance of victory in Taiwan's first-past-the-post system. In 2020's election, the DPP won in a landslide, taking 56% of the vote, but only had to face one main opponent, the KMT's Han Kuo-yu.翻译:反对派的分裂让赖智在台湾的简单当选制中获胜的机会增加。 2020年大选，民进党以56%的选票以压倒性优势获胜，但只面对一个主要对手，即国民党的韩国瑜。

Reporting by Beijing newsroom and Ben Blanchard; Editing by Gerry Doyle翻译:北京新闻编辑室和本·布兰查德的报道；格里·多伊尔编辑

item.title: 月底中国货币市场出现流动性紧张迹象
item.description:
Cash conditions in China's money market showed signs of tightness on Monday, as market participants grew cautious about month-end demand and a recent liquidity squeeze remained fresh in memory.翻译:周一，中国货币市场的现金状况显示出紧张迹象，市场参与者对月末需求变得谨慎，而且近期的流动性紧缩仍记忆犹新。

Despite fresh liquidity injections by the central bank to calm the market, traders and analysts said borrowing costs for the funds that could help financial institutions, especially non-banks, to tide over the critical month-end period remained high.翻译:尽管央行注入新的流动性以安抚市场，但交易员和分析师表示，有助于金融机构（尤其是非银行机构）度过关键月末时期的资金借贷成本仍然很高。

The price of the benchmark seven-day repos traded in the interbank market, hit a high of 2.8% on Monday, the highest level since Oct. 31. Meanwhile, the borrowing cost of such repos for non-bank financial institutions was about 3.5%, according to traders.翻译:银行间市场基准7天回购价格周一触及2.8%高点，创10月31日以来最高水平。同时，非银行金融机构此类回购的借贷成本约为3.5%据贸易商称。

"Money that can help span the month-end has tightening bias, and it's expensive for non-banks," said a trader at a Chinese bank.翻译:一家中资银行的交易员表示，“能够帮助渡过月底的资金存在紧缩倾向，而且对于非银行机构而言成本高昂。”

Some traders also said general sentiment was cautious due largely to fears of another cash crunch.翻译:一些交易员还表示，总体情绪持谨慎态度，主要是因为担心再次出现现金紧缩。

Routine month-end demand for cash in China's banking system snowballed into a scramble on Oct. 31 that pushed short-term funding rates as high as 50% in some cases, an incident that prompted the authorities to investigate.翻译:10月31日，中国银行系统的例行月末现金需求如滚雪球般加剧，导致短期融资利率在某些情况下高达50%，这一事件促使当局展开调查。

"The interbank money market now relies heavily on reverse repos, and bank's willingness to lend to their peers is low, and this may be one of the factors that triggers fluctuations in the funding costs towards the month-end," Liu Yu, analyst at GF Securities.翻译:“现在银行间货币市场严重依赖逆回购，银行向同业放贷的意愿较低，这可能是引发月底融资成本波动的因素之一。”广发证券。

The People's Bank of China (PBOC) injected a net 296 billion yuan ($41.05 billion) through reverse repos in open market operations on Monday, the third straight session of net cash offerings into the financial system.翻译:周一，中国人民银行（PBOC）通过公开市场操作逆回购净注入人民币2,960亿元（合410.5亿美元），这是连续第三个交易日向金融体系净注入现金。

The interest rate on one-year AAA-rated negotiable certificates of deposit (NCDs) , which measures short-term interbank borrowing costs, has been persistently trading higher to hit an over seven-month high of 2.6279%.翻译:衡量短期银行间借贷成本的一年期AAA级可转让存款证（NCD）利率持续走高，触及七个多月高点2.6279%。

NCDs has been a popular short-term debt instrument used by financial institutions in the interbank market for financing.翻译:非传染性疾病一直是金融机构在银行间市场融资的热门短期债务工具。

Sources told Reuters earlier this month that China's central bank asked some lenders to cap interest rates on an interbank debt instrument, referring to the rising short-term yields on bank debt and strains in funding markets.翻译:消息人士本月早些时候告诉路透社，中国央行要求一些银行限制银行间债务工具的利率，指的是银行债务短期收益率上升和融资市场紧张。

item.title: 中国卫生部寻求更多发热门诊以应对呼吸道疾病激增
item.description:
China's health ministry on Sunday urged local authorities to increase the number of fever clinics as the country grapples with a surge in respiratory illnesses in its first full winter since easing COVID-19 restrictions.翻译:中国卫生部周日敦促地方当局增加发热门诊的数量，因为中国正应对呼吸道疾病激增的问题，这是自放宽 COVID-19 限制以来的第一个完整冬季。

The spike become a global issue last week when the World Health Organization asked China for more information, citing a report on clusters of undiagnosed pneumonia in children by the Program for Monitoring Emerging Diseases.翻译:上周，世界卫生组织引用新发疾病监测计划关于儿童未确诊肺炎群的报告，要求中国提供更多信息，从而使病例激增成为一个全球性问题。

China and the WHO have faced questions about the transparency of reporting early in the pandemic, which emerged in the central Chinese city of Wuhan in late 2019. The WHO said on Friday no new or unusual pathogens had been found in the recent illnesses.翻译:中国和世界卫生组织在 2019 年底在中国中部城市武汉爆发的疫情早期报告透明度方面面临质疑。世界卫生组织周五表示，在最近的疾病中没有发现新的或不寻常的病原体。

National Health Commission spokesperson Mi Feng said on Sunday the surge in acute respiratory illnesses was linked to the simultaneous circulation of several kinds of pathogens, most prominently influenza.翻译:国家卫生健康委员会新闻发言人米锋周日表示，急性呼吸道疾病的激增与多种病原体同时传播有关，其中最突出的是流感。

"Efforts should be made to increase the number of relevant clinics and treatment areas, appropriately extend service hours and strengthen guarantees of drug supplies," Mi told a news conference.翻译:米在新闻发布会上说：“要努力增加相关诊所和治疗区的数量，适当延长服务时间，加强药品供应保障。”

"It is necessary to do a good job in epidemic prevention and control in key crowded places such as schools, childcare institutions and nursing homes, and to reduce the flow of people and visits."翻译:“要做好学校、托幼机构、养老院等重点人员密集场所的疫情防控，减少人员流动和探访。”

Cases among children are appearing especially high in northern areas like Beijing and Liaoning province, where hospitals are warning of long waits.翻译:在北京和辽宁省等北方地区，儿童病例尤其多，医院警告称，等待时间较长。

The State Council, China's cabinet, said on Friday that influenza would peak this winter and spring, while mycoplasma pneumoniae infection would remain high in some areas. It also warned of the risk of a rebound in COVID infections.翻译:中国国务院周五表示，今年冬春季流感高峰期将持续，部分地区肺炎支原体感染率仍将居高不下。它还警告了新冠病毒感染反弹的风险。

"All localities should strengthen information reporting on infectious diseases to ensure information is reported in a timely and accurate manner," the State Council said in a statement.翻译:国务院在一份声明中表示：“各地要加强传染病信息报告，确保信息报告及时、准确。”

On Thursday the WHO said data provided by China suggested the recent cases were linked to the lifting of COVID curbs 11 months ago, along with the circulation of known pathogens like mycoplasma pneumoniae, a common bacterial infection that typically affects children, which has circulated since May.翻译:周四，世界卫生组织表示，中国提供的数据表明，最近的病例与 11 个月前解除新冠疫情限制措施有关，同时还与肺炎支原体等已知病原体的传播有关。肺炎支原体是一种常见的细菌感染，通常影响儿童，自 5 月份以来一直在传播。 。

Reporting by Laurie Chen; Editing by William Mallard翻译:陈劳瑞报道；威廉·马拉德编辑

item.title: 中国工业利润增长放缓，刺激呼声持续高涨
item.description:
Profits at China's industrial firms extended gains for a third month in October, albeit at a slower pace, suggesting more policy support from Beijing is needed to help shore up growth in the world's second-largest economy.翻译:10月份中国工业企业利润连续第三个月增长，尽管增速放缓，这表明北京需要更多政策支持来帮助支撑世界第二大经济体的增长。

The 2.7% year-on-year rise sees profit growth narrow back to single-digits, following an 11.9% increase in September and a 17.2% gain in August, putting pressure on authorities to extend further assistance to manufacturers as soft global demand continues to dog policymakers heading into 2024.翻译:继 9 月增长 11.9% 和 8 月增长 17.2% 后，2.7% 的同比增长使利润增速收窄至个位数，这给当局带来压力，要求在全球需求持续疲软的情况下向制造商提供进一步援助。狗政策制定者即将进入 2024 年。

For the first 10 months of 2023, profits slid 7.8% from a year earlier, narrowing from a 9% decline in the first nine months, data from the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) showed on Monday.翻译:国家统计局周一公布的数据显示，2023年前10个月，利润同比下降7.8%，降幅较前9个月的9%收窄。

China's economy has struggled to mount a strong post-COVID recovery as distress in the housing market, local government debt risks, slow global growth and geopolitical tensions dented momentum.翻译:由于房地产市场低迷、地方政府债务风险、全球经济增长放缓和地缘政治紧张局势削弱了经济增长势头，中国经济在新冠疫情后难以实现强劲复苏。

A flurry of policy support measures has had only modest effect, raising pressure on authorities to roll out more stimulus.翻译:一系列政策支持措施收效甚微，加大了当局推出更多刺激措施的压力。

"Three consecutive months of positive profit growth suggest that the worst times, when profitability was squeezed by high input costs, overcapacity and soft demand, are over," said Xu Tianchen, senior economist at the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU).翻译:经济学人智库(EIU)高级经济学家徐天辰表示，“利润连续三个月正增长表明，利润率因高投入成本、产能过剩和需求疲软而受到挤压的最糟糕时期已经结束。”

"However, the volatility of profits is a sign enterprises remain highly sensitive to input costs," he added. "The sharp slowdown of year-on-year profit growth was partly driven by a rebound in energy prices."翻译:“然而，利润的波动表明企业对投入成本仍然高度敏感，”他补充道。 “利润增速同比大幅放缓，部分原因是能源价格反弹。”

The NBS said authorities should "focus on expanding domestic demand and inspiring businesses," in a nod to factories' trade challenges.翻译:国家统计局表示，当局应“集中精力扩大内需、激发企业活力”，以应对工厂面临的贸易挑战。

Data for October has been mixed.翻译:十月份的数据好坏参半。

Both new export and import orders shrank for an eighth consecutive month in October, according to the official purchasing managers' index (PMI). However, industrial output grew 4.6% in October, compared with the same period a year earlier, buoyed by strong autos and restaurant sales.翻译:根据官方采购经理人指数（PMI），10 月份新出口和进口订单连续第八个月下降。然而，在汽车和餐饮销售强劲的推动下，10 月份工业产出与去年同期相比增长了4.6%。

Goldman Sachs wrote in a note that "the divergence in profits across various sectors and firms remained significant".翻译:高盛在一份报告中写道，“不同行业和公司之间的利润差异仍然很大”。

Profits at furniture firms fell 11.8% over the first 10 months of 2023 year-on-year, for example, while electronics manufacturers saw profits jump 20.8% over the same period.翻译:例如，2023 年前 10 个月，家具公司的利润同比下降 11.8%，而电子产品制造商的利润同期增长 20.8%。

"Early signs of a comeback in the global electronics cycle will work in Chinese manufacturers' favour," said the EIU's Xu, who warned of downside across the sector and overcapacity across electric vehicles, lithium batteries and solar cells in 2024.翻译:EIU 的 Xu 表示：“全球电子行业复苏的早期迹象将对中国制造商有利。”他警告称，2024 年该行业将出现下行趋势，电动汽车、锂电池和太阳能电池将出现产能过剩。

LONGi Green Energy Technology Co (601012.SS), a major domestic solar energy manufacturer, saw its third quarter net profit plummet 44.1% to 2.5 billion yuan ($346.7 million), hit by macroeconomic headwinds and a supply glut.翻译:国内主要太阳能制造商隆基绿色能源科技有限公司（601012.SS）第三季度净利润暴跌44.1%至25亿元人民币（3.467亿美元），受到宏观经济逆风和供应过剩的打击。

On Monday, China's central bank and other authorities called for more measures to strengthen financial support for private companies, including allowing increased issuance of loans, bonds and shares.翻译:周一，中国央行和其他当局呼吁采取更多措施加强对私营企业的金融支持，包括允许增加贷款、债券和股票的发行。

The central bank governor earlier this month said: "transforming the economic growth mode is more important than pursuing a high growth rate," suggesting an urgent need for longer-term structural reforms as investment-led growth loses steam.翻译:央行行长本月早些时候表示：“转变经济增长方式比追求高增长更重要”，这表明随着投资拉动的增长失去动力，迫切需要进行长期结构性改革。

China's blue chip CSI300 index fell 1.21% after the data while Hong Kong's Hang Seng lost 1.07%.翻译:数据公布后，中国蓝筹股沪深300指数下跌1.21%，香港恒生指数下跌1.07%。

State-owned firms posted a 9.9% decline in earnings in the first 10 months, foreign firms recorded a 10.2% slide and private-sector companies saw profits down 1.9%, according to a breakdown of the NBS data.翻译:根据国家统计局的详细数据，今年前 10 个月，国有企业利润下降 9.9%，外资企业利润下降 10.2%，私营企业利润下降 1.9%。

Industrial profits data covers firms with annual revenues of at least 20 million yuan ($2.74 million) from their main operations.翻译:工业利润数据涵盖主营业务年收入至少 2000 万元人民币（274 万美元）的企业。

($1 = 7.2922 Chinese yuan)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2922 人民币）

Reporting by Joe Cash, Liz Lee and Qiaoyi Li. Editing by Sam Holmes翻译:乔·卡什 (Joe Cash)、利兹·李 (Liz Lee) 和李巧仪 (Qiaoyi Li) 报道。山姆·霍姆斯编辑

item.title: 中国需要畅通、维持私营企业的金融渠道
item.description:
Top Chinese government departments led by the central bank said on Monday that measures needed to be stepped up to strengthen financial support for private companies, including unblocking and sustaining of funding channels.翻译:以央行为首的中国政府最高部门周一表示，需要加大力度加强对私营企业的金融支持，包括畅通和维持融资渠道。

State agencies have in recent months unveiled a flurry of initiatives to support private businesses after authorities vowed to make the sector "bigger, better and stronger", in a bid to shore up an economic recovery.翻译:近几个月来，当局誓言要让私营企业“更大、更好、更强” ，以支撑经济复苏，国家机构推出了一系列支持私营企业的举措。

Private firms, which account for 60% of China's gross domestic product and 80% of urban jobs, were hurt by three years of COVID curbs and a regulatory crackdown that targeted sectors from technology to private tutoring.翻译:私营企业占中国国内生产总值的 60%，占城市就业岗位的 80%，三年来的新冠疫情限制措施和针对从技术到私人辅导等行业的监管打压对私营企业造成了伤害。

Efforts should be made to "unblock" financial channels such as loans, bonds and shares, said the People's Bank of China (PBOC) in a joint statement with seven other government departments and regulators.翻译:中国人民银行在与其他七个政府部门和监管机构的联合声明中表示，应努力“畅通”贷款、债券和股票等金融渠道。

Banking and financial institutions should set annual service targets for private enterprises, increase the weight of related businesses serving private enterprises in performance appraisal and gradually increase the proportion of loans to private enterprises, it said.翻译:银行业金融机构要制定年度民营企业服务目标，提高服务民营企业相关业务绩效考核权重，逐步提高民营企业贷款比重。

The tolerance for non-performing loans of private companies should also be "reasonably" increased while offering more support for first-time borrowers, according to the joint statement, which outlined 25 measures aimed at bolstering financial support for China's private economy.翻译:联合声明称，还应“合理”提高对私营企业不良贷款的容忍度，同时为首次借款人提供更多支持，该声明概述了旨在加强对中国私营经济的金融支持的25条措施。

Additionally, banks should meet the reasonable financing demand of privately owned property enterprises, it said. Lenders are encouraged to take the lead on supporting private firms that have market competitiveness but encounter temporary difficulties by coordinating with other creditors on issuing syndicated loans.翻译:此外，银行要满足民营地产企业合理融资需求。鼓励贷款机构牵头支持具有市场竞争力但暂时遇到困难的民营企业，与其他债权人协调发放银团贷款。

Mounting problems in the cash-squeezed and indebted property sector, which accounts for a quarter of China's economic activity, have sparked fears of a broader financial crisis and weigh heavily on economic growth and consumer confidence.翻译:占中国经济活动四分之一的现金紧缩和负债累累的房地产行业日益严重的问题引发了人们对更广泛的金融危机的担忧，并严重影响了经济增长和消费者信心。

China has placed debt-laden Country Garden Holdings Co (2007.HK) on a draft list of 50 developers eligible for a range of financing support, Bloomberg reported last week.翻译:据彭博社上周报道，中国已将负债累累的碧桂园控股公司（2007.HK）列入了一份有资格获得一系列融资支持的 50 家开发商的草案名单中。

Beijing has been ramping up measures to support the world's second-largest economy, including a 1 trillion yuan ($139 billion) sovereign bond issuance plan and allowing local governments to frontload part of their 2024 bond quotas.翻译:北京一直在加大力度支持世界第二大经济体，包括1万亿元人民币（1,390亿美元）的主权债券发行计划，以及允许地方政府提前支付2024年部分债券配额。

The PBOC has also implemented modest interest rate cuts and pumped more cash into the economy in recent months, pledging to sustain policy support.翻译:近几个月来，中国央行还实施了小幅降息并向经济注入更多现金，承诺维持政策支持。

In September, it cut banks' reserve requirement ratio for the second time this year to free up more funds for lending. Analysts expect another cut by year-end.翻译:9月份，中国第二次下调银行存款准备金率，以释放更多资金用于放贷。分析师预计年底前将再次降息。

China should also expand private firms' bond financing and guide financial institutions to expand the bond financing scale of private enterprises, according to the statement.翻译:声明指出，要扩大民营企业债券融资，引导金融机构扩大民营企业债券融资规模。

China should back the listing, mergers and acquisitions, and reorganisation of private enterprises, including supporting qualified companies in going public overseas, it said.翻译:支持民营企业上市、并购重组，包括支持符合条件的企业到境外上市。

Financial institutions should also maintain continuity in their services, even when some companies run into temporary difficulties.翻译:即使一些企业遇到暂时困难，金融机构也应保持服务的连续性。

"The principle is to meet the continued financing needs in advance and not to blindly stop, suppress, withdraw or cut off loans," according to the statement.翻译:声明称，原则是提前满足持续融资需求，不盲目停贷、压贷、断贷。

Government efforts to support the private sector included the establishment of a special bureau within the top state planners and tax and fee support for small businesses.翻译:政府支持私营部门的努力包括在国家最高规划者内部设立一个特别局，以及为小企业提供税收和费用支持。

Fixed-asset investment by private firms fell 0.6% in January-September year-on-year, highlighting weak private sector confidence. ($1 = 7.2111 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:1-9月私营企业固定资产投资同比下降0.6%，凸显私营部门信心疲弱。 （1 美元 = 7.2111 人民币）

Reporting by Ryan Woo and Ziyi Tang and Kevin Yao; Editing by Christopher Cushing翻译:Ryan Woo、Ziyi Tang 和 Kevin Yao 报道；克里斯托弗·库欣编辑

item.title: 绿色和平组织指责中国石油和天然气公司“洗绿”液化天然气采购
item.description:
Big oil and gas companies in China and elsewhere are using low-quality carbon offsets to "greenwash" their imports of natural gas while failing to make strong emissions cutting commitments, environment group Greenpeace said on Monday.翻译:环境组织绿色和平组织周一表示，中国和其他地方的大型石油和天然气公司正在利用低质量的碳补偿来“绿色清洗”其进口天然气，同时未能做出强有力的减排承诺。

Firms like PetroChina (601857.SS) and CNOOC Gas and Power have signed long-term contracts with Shell (SHEL.L) to buy "carbon neutral" liquefied natural gas (LNG), which uses "forest offsets" to balance out carbon emissions.翻译:中石油（601857.SS）和中海油燃气电力等公司已与壳牌（SHEL.L）签署长期合同，购买“碳中和”液化天然气（LNG），利用“森林补偿”来平衡碳排放。

Greenpeace, which has long opposed fossil fuel producers counting carbon offsets toward their emissions reduction goals, said the "carbon neutral" branding was misleading the public.翻译:绿色和平组织长期以来一直反对化石燃料生产商将碳抵消计入其减排目标，并表示“碳中和”品牌误导了公众。

"For oil and gas companies in particular, carbon offsets are a smokescreen to obscure their continued, redoubled carbon emissions," said Li Jiatong, project leader with Greenpeace in Beijing.翻译:北京绿色和平组织项目负责人李家同表示：“特别是对于石油和天然气公司来说，碳补偿就像烟幕弹一样，掩盖了它们持续增加的碳排放量。”

PetroChina didn't respond to a request for comment. CNOOC Oil and Gas's parent company said it was not itself involved in LNG purchases. Shell declined to comment on Greenpeace's report.翻译:中石油没有回应置评请求。中海油石油天然气公司的母公司表示，其本身并未参与液化天然气采购。壳牌拒绝对绿色和平组织的报告发表评论。

Many of the offsets were not being measured consistently and sometimes were being double counted, Greenpeace said. And some forests tied to offset schemes were vulnerable to fires that could turn them into a carbon source, rather than a carbon sink.翻译:绿色和平组织表示，许多抵消措施没有得到一致的衡量，有时甚至被重复计算。一些与补偿计划相关的森林很容易遭受火灾，这可能会将它们变成碳源，而不是碳汇。

Greenpeace said credits from 15 forestry carbon sink projects in China, involving Shell, PetroChina, CNOOC and other companies, have already been banked, but 80% of the projects planted trees that are at medium- to high-risk of burning down.翻译:绿色和平表示，中国15个林业碳汇项目的信贷已入库，涉及壳牌、中石油、中海油等公司，但80%的项目种植的树木存在中度至高度烧毁风险。

Rising sales of "carbon neutral" LNG are being driven by a surge in gas demand, particularly in Asia. Around 85% of carbon neutral cargoes have been sold to Asian buyers, Greenpeace said.翻译:天然气需求激增推动了“碳中性”液化天然气销量的增长，尤其是在亚洲。绿色和平组织表示，约 85% 的碳中和货物已出售给亚洲买家。

China's gas consumption is expected to reach 250 billion cubic metres by 2026, up from 216 bcm last year, accounting for almost half of new global demand over the period, the International Energy Agency said.翻译:国际能源署表示，到2026年，中国天然气消费量预计将达到2500亿立方米，高于去年的216立方米，几乎占同期全球新增需求的一半。

The idea of "carbon neutral" gas is likely to be on the agenda during COP28 talks starting this week, said Polly Hemming, director of the Climate and Energy Program at the Australia Institute.翻译:澳大利亚研究所气候与能源项目主任波莉·海明表示，“碳中性”天然气的想法可能会在本周开始的 COP28 会谈中列入议程。

While it is still a major source of greenhouse gas emissions, gas is cleaner than coal and has been described as a "bridge fuel" in the global energy transition, but anti-fossil fuel groups oppose any new gas projects.翻译:虽然天然气仍然是温室气体排放的主要来源，但它比煤炭更清洁，被称为全球能源转型的“桥梁燃料”，但反化石燃料团体反对任何新的天然气项目。

"Stapling those offsets to fossil fuels and claiming that they are net zero - it's bonkers," said Hemming.翻译:“将这些抵消额固定在化石燃料上，并声称它们是净零——这是疯狂的，”海明说。

Reporting by David Stanway; Additional reporting by Andrew Hayley and Emily Chow; Editing by Sonali Paul翻译:大卫·斯坦威报道；安德鲁·海利 (Andrew Hayley) 和艾米丽·周 (Emily Chow) 的补充报道；索纳利·保罗编辑

item.title: 马来西亚从12月1日起允许中国和印度公民免签证入境
item.description:
Malaysia will grant visa-free entry to citizens of China and India for stays of up to 30 days starting on Dec. 1, according to Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.翻译:马来西亚总理安瓦尔·易卜拉欣 (Anwar Ibrahim) 表示，从 12 月 1 日起，马来西亚将给予中国和印度公民免签证入境，停留期限最长为 30 天。

Anwar made the announcement late on Sunday during a speech at his People's Justice Party congress and did not say for how long the visa exemption would be applicable.翻译:安瓦尔周日晚在人民正义党代表大会上发表讲话时宣布了这一消息，但没有透露签证豁免将适用多长时间。

China and India are Malaysia's fourth and fifth-largest source markets respectively.翻译:中国和印度分别是马来西亚第四大和第五大客源市场。

According to government data, Malaysia recorded 9.16 million tourist arrivals between January and June this year, with 498,540 from China and 283,885 from India. That compared to 1.5 million arrivals from China and 354,486 from India in the same period of 2019, prior to the pandemic.翻译:根据政府数据，今年1月至6月，马来西亚接待了916万人次游客，其中498,540人次来自中国，283,885人次来自印度。相比之下，2019 年同期，大流行之前，来自中国的游客为 150 万人，来自印度的游客为 354,486 人。

The move follows similar measures implemented by neighbouring Thailand to boost its vital tourism sector and stimulate its sluggish economy, with Chinese and Indian nationals among those exempted this year.翻译:此前，邻国泰国也采取了类似措施，以提振其重要的旅游业并刺激其疲软的经济，中国和印度国民今年获得了豁免。

Currently, Chinese and Indian nationals must apply for visas to enter Malaysia.翻译:目前，中国和印度公民必须申请签证才能进入马来西亚。

Reporting by Danial Azhar; Editing by Martin Petty翻译:丹尼尔·阿扎尔报道；马丁·佩蒂编辑

item.title: 中国转向家庭来努力减少碳排放
item.description:
Summary:
  • China offers households incentives to curb carbon emissions
  • Government aims to tie individuals into emissions trading
  • Critics fear plan will let big polluters off the hook
  • Unclear if schemes spur new CO2 cuts
翻译:概括：
  • 中国为家庭提供抑制碳排放的激励措施
  • 政府旨在将个人纳入排放交易
  • 批评者担心该计划将使大型污染企业摆脱困境
  • 尚不清楚该计划是否会刺激新的二氧化碳减排

At a gleaming new metro station on the edge of Shenzhen, the local government is promoting "carbon coins" to commuters to earn and trade for shopping vouchers and travel cards in a push to get households to join China's fight against climate change.翻译:在深圳边缘一个闪闪发光的新地铁站，当地政府正在向通勤者推广“碳币”，以赚取和交易购物券和旅行卡，以推动家庭加入中国应对气候变化的斗争。

The southeastern city's "Carbon Road for Everyone" scheme, which rewards people for logging their use of public transport, is one of dozens around China encouraging citizens to ditch cars, plant trees and cut energy use.翻译:这个东南部城市的“人人碳路”计划奖励人们记录公共交通的使用情况，这是中国各地鼓励公民放弃汽车、植树和减少能源使用的数十项计划之一。

The so-called "carbon inclusion" programmes are part of the ruling Communist Party's campaign to mobilise the whole of society, not just industry, to transform the world's biggest greenhouse gas emitter into a carbon-neutral country by 2060.翻译:所谓的“碳包容”计划是执政的共产党动员整个社会而不仅仅是工业界的运动的一部分，目的是到2060年将世界上最大的温室气体排放国转变为碳中和国家。

China's efforts to tackle climate change will come under intense scrutiny as negotiators from around the world gather for the COP28 meetings in Dubai next week.翻译:随着来自世界各地的谈判代表下周齐聚迪拜参加 COP28 会议，中国应对气候变化的努力将受到密切关注。

While the country's emissions reduction task is massive, potential cuts by individuals could be huge. A 2021 study by the China Academy of Sciences said households contribute more than half of China's total emissions of over 10 billion metric tons per year.翻译:虽然国家的减排任务艰巨，但个人的减排潜力也可能很大。中国科学院2021年的一项研究称，中国每年超过100亿吨的总排放量中一半以上是家庭排放。

"Carbon inclusion is a huge platform and an effective way to mobilise the public to practice low-carbon, zero-carbon and negative-carbon activities," said Xie Zhenhua, China's top climate envoy, during the launch of a government carbon inclusion committee in August.翻译:“碳包容是一个巨大的平台，也是动员公众践行低碳、零碳、负碳活动的有效途径，”中国最高气候特使解振华在政府碳包容委员会成立仪式上表示。八月。

Eventually, China wants the schemes to be integrated into national emissions trading and generate credits that can offset emissions by industrial polluters, government plans show.

PERSONAL CARBON TRADING

China's carbon inclusion ambitions have been in gestation since 2015, when the southeastern province of Guangdong published rules on how to convert low-carbon activity into credits.翻译:中国的碳包容雄心自2015年以来一直在酝酿之中，当时东南部省份广东省发布了如何将低碳活动转化为信用额的规定。

Since then, dozens of schemes have emerged across the country, accessing personal data like step counts, the use of transport, and the purchase of efficient or environmentally friendly products to generate carbon coins.翻译:从那时起，全国各地出现了数十个计划，通过访问步数、交通使用情况以及购买高效或环保产品等个人数据来生成碳币。

Banks have also been testing "personal carbon account" systems. The People's Bank of China set up a pilot "carbon to gold loan" scheme in the city of Quzhou, allowing customers to earn carbon points that could improve credit ratings.翻译:银行也一直在测试“个人碳账户”系统。中国人民银行在衢州市试点开展“碳金贷”计划，让客户获得碳积分，从而提高信用评级。

Other countries have toyed with the idea of personal carbon trading, with pilot schemes set up in Finland and Australia's Norfolk Island. The British environment ministry also commissioned a study into the possibility in 2006 but concluded it was not yet politically or economically feasible.翻译:其他国家也曾尝试过个人碳交易的想法，芬兰和澳大利亚诺福克岛设立了试点计划。英国环境部也在 2006 年委托进行了一项可能性研究，但得出的结论是，这在政治或经济上尚不可行。

Singapore is currently running a scheme that rewards efficient electricity users with "leaf" tokens that can be exchanged for shopping vouchers.翻译:新加坡目前正在实施一项计划，用“叶子”代币奖励高效的电力用户，这些代币可以兑换成购物券。

"Various actors have tried voluntary schemes that do things like visualisations or the sharing of energy or emissions data at a smaller scale," said Benjamin Sovacool, a professor of Earth and Environment at Boston University.翻译:波士顿大学地球与环境教授本杰明·索瓦库尔（Benjamin Sovacool）表示：“各种参与者都尝试过自愿计划，比如可视化或在较小范围内共享能源或排放数据。”

"But they lack the scale and sheer scope of what the Chinese are conceiving, and they were not integrated into carbon coins, which is a clever idea."

QUANTIFICATION, TRADING HURDLES

A major challenge is how to commodify carbon dioxide emissions reductions from a wide range of human behaviour - including the way people go to work, heat their household or put out the trash.翻译:一个主要挑战是如何将各种人类行为（包括人们上班、取暖或倒垃圾的方式）的二氧化碳排放量商品化。

"It's all about verification," said Yifei Li, professor of Environmental Studies at New York University's Shanghai campus. "When it comes to the level of variability, how people conduct their lives is so wildly different. That is a big problem."翻译:“这一切都与验证有关，”纽约大学上海校区环境研究教授李一飞说。 “就可变性而言，人们的生活方式差异很大。这是一个大问题。”

Zhang Xin, vice-chairman of the environment ministry's carbon inclusion committee, said better standards were needed to quantify low-carbon behaviour, warning in comments published this year that the proliferation of schemes "has resulted in confusion and inconsistency."翻译:环境部碳包容委员会副主席张欣表示，需要更好的标准来量化低碳行为，并在今年发表的评论中警告说，计划的激增“导致了混乱和不一致”。

Scholars also say it is unclear whether the schemes generate new cuts in carbon dioxide emissions or merely record those that happen anyway.翻译:学者们还表示，目前还不清楚这些计划是否会带来新的二氧化碳排放量削减，或者只是记录已经发生的情况。

Shanghai said in regulations that came into effect this month its schemes would eventually be "fully connected" to the local carbon market, with enterprises allowed to apply to use household carbon cuts to meet targets.翻译:上海在本月生效的法规中表示，其计划最终将与当地碳市场“完全连接”，允许企业申请利用家庭碳减排来实现目标。

Guangdong also allows enterprises to meet 10% of carbon reduction obligations through carbon inclusion credits.翻译:广东还允许企业通过碳普惠信用额履行10%的碳减排义务。

China is still a long way from fulfilling such emissions trading ambitions. Most users remain passive participants: one Beijing-based scheme claims more than 30 million users, but only 1.4% are active, according to research published this year.翻译:中国距离实现此类排放交易雄心还有很长的路要走。大多数用户仍然是被动参与者：根据今年发布的研究，北京的一项计划声称拥有超过 3000 万用户，但只有 1.4% 是活跃用户。

And there are worries the carbon inclusion schemes could let industrial polluters off the hook by shifting the burden of emission cuts to households.翻译:人们担心，碳包容计划可能会将减排负担转移给家庭，从而让工业污染者摆脱困境。

"The direction they're going in at the moment is indeed to transfer climate responsibilities from these big firms and more towards individuals," said Li.翻译:“他们目前的方向确实是将气候责任从这些大公司转移到个人身上，”李说。

"That is extremely dangerous," he added, as it can "alienate individuals from climate action."

VOLUNTARY VS COMPULSORY

While tens of millions of people have already signed up to schemes around the country, some experts fear it will give the state more powers to interfere with people's lives and punish those who fail to make the right low-carbon choices.翻译:尽管全国各地已有数千万人签署了该计划，但一些专家担心，这将赋予国家更多权力来干预人们的生活并惩罚那些未能做出正确低碳选择的人。

"While the scheme currently is voluntary, the lack of transparency, the unaccountable nature of the Chinese government and the government's track record of using big data for social control are all reasons for concern," said Yaqiu Wang, research director for China at the Freedom House think tank.翻译:“虽然该计划目前是自愿的，但缺乏透明度、中国政府不负责任的性质以及政府利用大数据进行社会控制的记录都是令人担忧的原因，”自由研究中心中国研究主任王亚秋表示。众议院智库。

Critics point to China's handling of environmental problems with controversial measures such as shutting thousands of businesses to cut pollution, relocating homes to make way for national parks and banning poor households from using coal for heating.翻译:批评者指出，中国在处理环境问题时采取了有争议的措施，例如关闭数千家企业以减少污染、搬迁房屋为国家公园让路以及禁止贫困家庭使用煤炭取暖。

China climate official Su Wei told local media the green transformation of China would "inevitably involve profound changes in people's daily habits and consumption patterns", but he said carbon inclusion schemes would remain voluntary.翻译:中国气候官员苏伟告诉当地媒体，中国的绿色转型“不可避免地会涉及人们日常习惯和消费模式的深刻变化”，但他表示碳包容计划仍将是自愿的。

The carbon coin promotion at the Shenzhen station drew little interest among commuters on a busy working day in October. However, the local government was upbeat about the project, saying last month it had registered 14.6 million users since its launch in August 2022, cutting emissions by 720,000 metric tons.翻译:在十月份繁忙的工作日，深圳站的碳币促销活动并没有引起乘客的兴趣。不过，当地政府对该项目持乐观态度，上个月表示，自 2022 年 8 月启动以来，该项目已注册用户 1,460 万，减排 72 万吨。

Reporting by David Stanway in Singapore; Additional reporting by David Kirton in Shenzhen; Editing by Sonali Paul翻译:大卫·斯坦威驻新加坡报道； David Kirton 在深圳的补充报道；索纳利·保罗编辑
item.author: David Stanway, David Kirton

item.title: 中国、日本、韩国寻求峰会以缓和关系
item.description:
China, Japan and South Korea agreed on Sunday to restart cooperation and pave the way for a summit in the latest move to ease tensions between the Asian neighbours.翻译:中国、日本和韩国周日同意重启合作，为峰会铺平道路，这是缓解亚洲邻国之间紧张关系的最新举措。

Even as China and the United States seek to mend frayed ties, including a summit this month between Presidents Xi Jinping and Joe Biden, Beijing is concerned that Washington and its key regional allies are strengthening their three-way partnership.翻译:尽管中美两国寻求修复紧张的关系，包括本月习近平主席和拜登总统举行峰会，但北京仍担心华盛顿及其主要地区盟友正在加强三向伙伴关系。

Beijing, Seoul and Tokyo had agreed on annual summits from 2008 to bolster diplomatic and economic exchanges, but two-way rows and the COVID pandemic interrupted the plan, with the three leaders last meeting in 2019.翻译:北京、首尔和东京已同意从 2008 年起每年举行峰会，以加强外交和经济交流，但双向争端和新冠疫情中断了这一计划，三位领导人上次会面是在 2019 年。

The three foreign ministers met in the South Korean port of Busan for their first such meeting since 2019, after officials of the three countries agreed in September to arrange a trilateral summit at the "earliest convenient time".翻译:三位外长在韩国釜山港举行了自 2019 年以来的首次此类会晤，此前三国官员于 9 月同意“尽早”安排三边峰会。

The three ministers did not specify a timeframe for the summit.翻译:三位部长没有具体说明峰会的时间表。

China's Xi, Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol may not be able to meet this year, but their summit is likely in the near future, South Korea's national security adviser, Cho Tae-yong, told Yonhap news TV.翻译:韩国国家安全顾问赵泰勇告诉韩联社新闻电视台，中国国家主席习近平、日本首相岸田文雄和韩国总统尹锡烈今年可能无法会面，但他们的峰会很可能在不久的将来举行。

The ministers agreed in their 100-minute talks to advance cooperation in six areas, including security, economy and technology, and promote concrete discussions to prepare for the summit, Japan's foreign ministry said in a statement.翻译:日本外务省在一份声明中表示，部长们在100分钟的会谈中同意推进安全、经济和技术等六个领域的合作，并推动具体讨论，为峰会做准备。

South Korean Foreign Minister Park Jin, who was also concerned about North Korean issues, told his counterparts it was "important to further institutionalise trilateral cooperation so that it will develop into a stable and sustainable system", his ministry said in a statement.翻译:韩国外交部在一份声明中表示，同样担心朝鲜问题的韩国外交部长朴镇告诉外长，“进一步将三边合作制度化，使其发展成为一个稳定和可持续的体系非常重要”。

China's Wang Yi said the three countries should "oppose ideological demarcation and resist putting regional cooperation into camps", in comments aimed at Seoul and Tokyo's alliance with Washington.翻译:中国王毅在针对首尔和东京与华盛顿联盟的评论中表示，这三个国家应“反对意识形态划分，抵制将区域合作置于阵营”。

Wang also called on the three countries to restart negotiations on a trilateral free trade agreement as soon as possible, according to a Chinese foreign ministry readout.翻译:据中国外交部通报，王还呼吁这三个国家尽快重启三边自由贸易协定谈判。

Japan's Yoko Kamikawa said greater trilateral cooperation would contribute to regional peace as the international security situation has become "more severe and complex than ever".翻译:日本的上川洋子表示，随着国际安全局势变得“比以往任何时候都更加严峻和复杂”，加强三边合作将有助于地区和平。

In bilateral talks, Park and Kamikawa condemned North Korea's launch last week of its first spy satellite and agreed to boost responses to arms deals between Pyongyang and Moscow, Seoul's foreign ministry said in a statement.翻译:首尔外交部在一份声明中表示，在双边会谈中，朴槿惠和上川谴责朝鲜上周发射第一颗间谍卫星，并同意加强对平壤与莫斯科之间武器交易的回应。

Marring the co-operative tone, Kamikawa described as "extremely regrettable" a South Korean court's order for Japan to compensate a group of women forced to work in its wartime brothels and asked Seoul to take appropriate measures, Japan's Kyodo news agency said.翻译:日本共同社称，日本共同社称，韩国法院下令日本赔偿一群被迫在战时妓院工作的妇女，神川的合作语气对此表示“极其遗憾”，并要求首尔采取适当措施。

Park, meeting separately with China's Wang, invited him to visit Seoul, and they agreed to reinforce strategic communications, Seoul said. Park asked for China to play a constructive role in encouraging North Korea to avoid further provocations and take the path towards denuclearisation.翻译:首尔表示，朴槿惠分别会见了中国国家主席王毅，邀请他访问首尔，双方同意加强战略沟通。朴槿惠要求中国发挥建设性作用，鼓励朝鲜避免进一步挑衅，走无核化道路。

Beijing's foreign ministry said Wang warned Park not to politicise economic and technology issues, amid China-U.S. tension over semiconductors and other trade disputes.翻译:北京外交部表示，王警告朴槿惠不要将经济和技术问题政治化，因为中美在半导体和其他贸易争端方面关系紧张。

Kamikawa, meeting Wang on Saturday, expressed hopes for a security dialogue between Tokyo and Beijing "in the near future". Wang highlighted the need for China and Japan to ensure they "do not pose a threat" to each another and respect the legitimate concerns of each, Beijing said.翻译:上川周六会见了王毅， 表示希望东京和北京“在不久的将来”进行安全对话。北京表示，王强调中日两国需要确保彼此“不构成威胁”，并尊重各自的合理关切。

South Korea's Yoon and Japan's Kishida have moved to mend ties frayed by history and trade feuds, holding a historic three-way summit in August with Biden.翻译:韩国的尹恩惠和日本的岸田已采取行动，修复因历史和贸易争端而破裂的关系，并于八月与拜登举行了历史性的三方峰会。

In July, Wang warned that U.S. efforts to strengthen ties with Seoul and Tokyo could fan regional tension and spark confrontation.翻译:7月，王警告称，美国加强与首尔和东京关系的努力可能会加剧地区紧张局势并引发对抗。

item.title: 中国警告韩国不要将经济问题政治化
item.description:
Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi warned his South Korean counterpart on Sunday not to politicise economic and tech issues as the two prepared to meet Japan's top diplomat on the sidelines of a trilateral meeting aimed at boosting cooperation.翻译:中国外交部长王毅周日警告韩国外长不要将经济和技术问题政治化，因为两国准备在旨在促进合作的三边会议期间会见日本最高外交官。

"China and South Korea have become cooperation partners with highly integrated interests and highly interconnected production and supply chains," Wang told South Korean Foreign Minister Park Jin, according to a Chinese foreign ministry readout.翻译:据中国外交部报道，王毅对韩国外交部长朴进说：“中韩已成为利益高度融合、生产供应链高度互联的合作伙伴。”

"Both sides should jointly resist the tendency to politicise economic issues, instrumentalise science and tech issues, and the broad securitisation of trade issues."翻译:双方应共同抵制经济问题政治化、科技问题工具化、贸易问题广泛证券化的倾向。

South Korea has sought to avoid becoming embroiled in a tit-for-tat row between China and the United States over semiconductors.翻译:韩国一直试图避免卷入中美在半导体领域的针锋相对的争端。

The U.S. last month granted Samsung Electronics (005930.KS) and SK Hynix (000660.KS) permission to supply U.S. chip equipment to their China factories indefinitely, ending a conundrum for the world's two largest memory chipmakers.翻译:美国上个月批准三星电子（005930.KS）和SK海力士（000660.KS） 无限期向其中国工厂供应美国芯片设备，结束了全球最大的两家存储芯片制造商的难题。

"China is willing to jointly promote the restart of revamped trilateral cooperation with South Korea and Japan," Wang said on Sunday.翻译:“中方愿与韩日共同推动重启三方合作，”王周日表示。

While China and the United States have been mending frayed ties, including a summit this month between Presidents Xi Jinping and Joe Biden, Beijing is concerned that Washington and its key regional allies are strengthening their three-way partnership.翻译:尽管中美两国一直在修复紧张的关系，包括本月习近平主席和拜登总统举行峰会，但北京方面对华盛顿及其主要地区盟友正在加强三方伙伴关系感到担忧。

Beijing, Tokyo and Seoul had agreed to hold summits every year starting in 2008 to bolster diplomatic and economic exchanges, but the plan has been blocked by bilateral rows and the COVID-19 pandemic. Their last trilateral leaders' meeting was in 2019.翻译:北京、东京和首尔同意从 2008 年开始每年举行峰会，以加强外交和经济交流，但该计划因双边争端和新冠肺炎 (COVID-19) 大流行而受阻。上一次三边领导人会议是在 2019 年。

The three foreign ministers are gathering in the port city of Busan, also the first such meeting since 2019. In September, senior officials from the three countries agreed to arrange a trilateral summit at the "earliest convenient time".翻译:三位外长齐聚港口城市釜山，这也是自 2019 年以来的首次此类会议。9 月，三个国家的高级官员同意在“尽早方便的时间”安排举行三边峰会。

South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida have taken steps to repair ties strained by history and trade feuds, and held a historic trilateral summit in August with Biden.翻译:韩国总统尹锡烈和日本首相岸田文雄已采取措施修复因历史和贸易争端而紧张的关系，并于 8 月与拜登举行了历史性的三边峰会。

Reporting by Laurie Chen; Editing by William Mallard翻译:陈劳瑞报道；威廉·马拉德编辑

item.title: 中国承诺深化与越南的贸易关系
item.description:
Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao pledged to deepen bilateral trade ties with Vietnam during a meeting with Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh in Ho Chi Minh City on Saturday, China's commerce ministry said.翻译:中国商务部表示，中国商务部部长王文涛周六在胡志明市会见越南总理范明正时承诺深化与越南的双边贸易关系。

Wang said China-Vietnam trade cooperation had already achieved "fruitful results" and would include strategic areas such as the digital economy, green development and cross-border e-commerce, according to a readout published late Saturday by the Chinese ministry.翻译:据中国商务部周六晚间发布的消息称，王毅表示，中越贸易合作已取得“丰硕成果”，并将涵盖数字经济、绿色发展和跨境电子商务等战略领域。

China and the United States have been jostling for influence among Southeast Asian nations including Vietnam, which in September elevated its ties with Washington to a comprehensive strategic partnership, putting its one-time enemy on par with Beijing and Moscow.翻译:中国和美国一直在争夺在包括越南在内的东南亚国家中的影响力，越南于9月将与华盛顿的关系提升为全面战略伙伴关系，将其曾经的敌人与北京和莫斯科平起平坐。

Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Sun Weidong held "frank and friendly talks" on bilateral ties, land borders and maritime issues with Vietnam's Deputy Foreign Minister Nguyen Minh Vu in Hanoi earlier this month.翻译:中国外交部副部长孙卫东本月早些时候在河内与越南外交部副部长阮明武就双边关系、陆地边界和海上问题进行了“坦诚友好的会谈”。

Sources familiar with the situation told Reuters last month that Vietnamese and Chinese officials were preparing for a possible trip by Chinese President Xi Jinping to Hanoi in late October or early November, although three Hanoi-based diplomats later said the visit was likely to be postponed until December.翻译:熟悉情况的消息人士上个月告诉路透社，越南和中国官员正在为中国国家主席习近平可能于 10 月底或 11 月初访问河内做准备，尽管三名驻河内外交官后来表示，访问可能会推迟到十二月。

Wang also met Ho Chi Minh City's Vietnamese Communist Party secretary Nguyen Van Nen on Saturday, the Chinese commerce ministry said.翻译:中国商务部称，王毅周六还会见了胡志明市市委书记阮文年。

Reporting by Laurie Chen; Editing by Edmund Klamann翻译:陈劳瑞报道；编辑：埃德蒙·克拉曼

item.title: 北京警方对陷入困境的财富管理公司中植立案调查
item.description:
Beijing police are investigating suspected crimes committed by Zhongzhi Enterprise Group, a leading Chinese wealth manager, according to a social media post published by the Chaoyang Public Security Bureau on Saturday.翻译:据朝阳市公安局周六发布的社交媒体帖子称，北京警方正在调查中国领先的财富管理公司中植企业集团涉嫌犯罪行为。

Zhongzhi earlier this week told investors it is heavily insolvent with up to $64 billion in liabilities, threatening to reignite concerns that China's property debt crisis is spilling over into the broader financial sector.翻译:中植本周早些时候告诉投资者，该公司已严重资不抵债，负债高达640 亿美元，这可能会再次引发人们对中国房地产债务危机蔓延至更广泛的金融领域的担忧。

The firm has sizable exposure to China's real estate sector and is a major player in China's $3 trillion shadow banking sector - roughly the size of the French economy.翻译:该公司在中国房地产行业拥有相当大的风险敞口，并且是中国规模达 3 万亿美元的影子银行业的主要参与者，该规模与法国经济规模大致相当。

Zhongzhi did not immediately reply to an email request for comment after normal business hours on Saturday. A phone call went unanswered.翻译:周六正常工作时间后，中植没有立即回复置评请求的电子邮件。一个电话无人接听。

Zhongzhi apologised to its investors in a letter issued on Wednesday that said it had total liabilities of about 420 billion yuan ($58 billion) to 460 billion yuan ($64 billion), compared to estimated total assets of 200 billion yuan.翻译:中植在周三发布的一封信中向投资者道歉，称其总负债约为人民币4200亿元（合580亿美元）至人民币4600亿元（合640亿美元），而总资产估计为人民币2000亿元。

The social media post from Beijing authorities said it was looking into "many" suspects involved with the company and encouraged investors to report their losses in order to help with the ongoing investigation.翻译:北京当局在社交媒体上发帖称，正在调查与该公司有关的“许多”嫌疑人，并鼓励投资者报告损失，以协助正在进行的调查。

"Investors are requested to actively cooperate with the police in investigating and collecting evidence and safeguard their rights and interests through legal channels," it read in part.翻译:“请投资者积极配合警方调查取证，通过法律途径维护自身权益，”其中部分内容写道。

The post did not specify what crimes Zhongzhi or the individuals were suspected of having committed.翻译:该帖子没有具体说明中植或这些人涉嫌犯下哪些罪行。

Reporting by Casey Hall Editing by Mark Potter翻译:凯西·霍尔报道 马克·波特编辑

item.title: 日本和中国外长同意举行安全会谈、改善关系的计划
item.description:
Japan and China are hoping to hold security talks "in the near future", Japanese Foreign Minister Yoko Kamikawa said on Saturday after meeting with China's top diplomat Wang Yi in South Korea.翻译:日本外务大臣上川洋子周六在韩国会见中国最高外交官王毅后表示，日本和中国希望“在不久的将来”举行安全会谈。

The talks between Kamikawa and Wang marked the first time the two senior diplomats had met since Kamikawa became Japan's foreign minister in September and followed the first face-to-face talks in a year by their countries' leaders earlier this month.翻译:上川和王之间的会谈是自九月上川就任日本外相以来两位高级外交官的首次会面，此前两国领导人本月早些时候进行了一年来的首次面对面会谈。

"We confirmed that we are seeking further close communication on a variety of issues... and we are hoping to hold security talks in the near future," Kamikawa told reporters.翻译:“我们确认，我们正在寻求就各种问题进行进一步密切沟通……我们希望在不久的将来举行安全会谈，”上川告诉记者。

An account of the meeting released by China's Foreign Ministry said Wang had emphasised the need for both sides to make clear they "do not pose a threat to one another", while respecting "each other's legitimate concerns".翻译:中国外交部发布的会议记录称，王毅强调双方需要明确表示“不对彼此构成威胁”，同时尊重“彼此的合理关切”。

Kamikawa said Japan was seeking a lifting of a Chinese ban on all Japanese seafood-related exports in the wake of the wastewater release from the crippled Fukushima nuclear power plant.翻译:上川表示，在受损的福岛核电站排放废水后，日本正在寻求解除中国对所有日本海鲜相关出口的禁令。

The Chinese ministry said it opposes "Japan's irresponsible practices" and that there was a need to establish a "long-term monitoring mechanism for all stakeholders."翻译:中国外交部表示反对“日方不负责任的做法”，并表示有必要建立“面向所有利益相关者的长期监督机制”。

Japan and China will also seek high level talks on the economy, Kamikawa said, adding that no date had been set.翻译:上川表示，日本和中国还将就经济问题寻求高层会谈，但日期尚未确定。

China's President Xi Jinping and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida met on the sidelines of an international conference in the United States on Nov. 17, where they agreed to pursue mutually beneficial relations.翻译:11月17日，中国国家主席习近平和日本首相岸田文雄在美国出席国际会议期间会见，一致同意发展互利共赢关系。

They appeared to emphasise shared economic interests amid a series of diplomatic disputes that have plagued relations between the two countries, including the release of wastewater from Fukushima into the Pacific and the detainment of a Japanese national in China.翻译:他们似乎在一系列困扰两国关系的外交争端中强调共同的经济利益，这些争端包括福岛废水排入太平洋以及一名日本公民在中国被拘留。

Kamikawa said she communicated Japan's stance on these issues, but also emphasised that Japan and China will be in close communication on the matters that divide them.翻译:上川表示，她传达了日方在这些问题上的立场，但也强调日中双方将就存在分歧的问题保持密切沟通。

"We also discussed issues that the countries must work together on... and we were able to have a meaningful exchange of views on climate change, international insurance, development finance, as well as the North Korea situation," she said, without elaborating.翻译:她说：“我们还讨论了各国必须共同努力解决的问题……我们能够就气候变化、国际保险、发展金融以及朝鲜局势等问题交换了有意义的意见。”但她没有详细说明。 。

Kamikawa and Wang will attend trilateral talks with their South Korean counterpart Park Jin on Sunday.翻译:上川和王将于周日与韩国外长朴镇参加三边会谈。
